about_the_game:
Featured in the first volume of Komodor Kards are three popular card games ... but with a twist!

Poker² - A version of poker solitaire, using (25) cards on a 5x5 grid.

Blackjax - A unique take on blackjack using (16) cards on a 4x4 grid.

Griddage - A new and exciting cribbage based game, using (16) cards on a 4x4 grid.

----------------------------------------

Poker²

Poker on a 5x5 grid? It's Poker²!

Create your ten best poker hands from (25) randomly selected cards. The values of rows and columns are totaled for a final score.

Think you know poker? Think again!

----------------------------------------

Blackjax

Blackjack on a 4x4 grid? It's Blackjax!

Create your eight best blackjack hands from (16) randomly selected cards. With four cards in each hand and a blackjack of 31, the values of rows and columns are totaled for a final score.

Try not to bust; you'll lose points if you do!

----------------------------------------

Griddage

Cribbage on a 4x4 grid? It's Griddage!

Create your eight best cribbage hands from (16) randomly selected cards. After placing your cards on the grid, reveal the flop card and see how you've fared. The values of rows and columns are totaled for a final score.

This isn't your parents game of crib!

----------------------------------------

Key Features:

Concise gameplay with accurate scoring.
Toggle between full screen and windowed gameplay while multitasking.
Option to mute music and sound allows for quiet gameplay or background music from other sources.
Rotating background color scheme.
The high score in each game is recorded and saved.

Please note that Poker² uses the English point system for scoring (e.g., straights and full houses are valued higher than flushes based on the number of cards in play).

short_description: A fresh take on (3) popular card games; Poker, Blackjack, and Cribbage, where strategy and forward-thinking guide you to place randomly selected cards on a grid, creating the best hands possible in each of the applicable rows and columns. Think you know cards? Think again!
